title: Buffalo Bills injury report has Mecole Hardman, Curtis Samuel listed
snippet: Bringing Codrington back is a tell-tale sign that the Bills will not have new kick returner Mecole Hardman, or wide receiver/returner Curtis Samuel, available for the game. Both Samuel (elbow and neck) and Hardman (calf) were hurt in last Sundayâ€™s victory over Tampa Bay. Hardman, who was just signed as a free agent last week which led to the release of Codrington from the 53-man roster, ripped off a 61-yard kickoff return on his first play with the team, but then later lost a fumble on a punt return and suffered the injury.

title: Curtis Samuel - NFL News, Rumors, & Updates | FOX Sports
snippet: He missed almost three weeks of practice due to a hamstring injury before returning to the field as a limited participant as of Aug. 15. title: Curtis Samuel - Wikipedia
snippet: Samuel began the 2025 season operating as a backup wide receiver, recording seven receptions for 81 yards and a touchdown across six appearances. He was placed on injured reserve on November 28, 2025, due to an elbow injury.
